description: From French salifier; from Latin sal (“salt”) + -ficare (“to make”) (only in comparative). See -fy.

verbs.description: salify (third-person singular simple present salifies, present participle salifying, simple past and past participle salified)

entries.meaning: (dated, chemistry) To react so as to form a salt
(dated, chemistry, transitive) To combine or impregnate with a salt.
(dated, chemistry, transitive) To form a salt with; to convert into a salt.
examples: to salify a base or an acid
